variant.question: The holder of a pilot licence has been suffering from a significant illness which involves his incapacity to function as a member of the flight crew. When shall he seek an aero-medical advice?

options.text: After 21 days of incapacity to function as a member of the flight crew.
After 7 days of incapacity to function as a member of the flight crew.
Seeking an aero-medical advice is not applicable in this case - the Authority must be informed within 3 days.

variant.question: On seeing a steady red light from ATC, what action should be taken by a pilot operating an aircraft on the ground?

options.text: Continue circling, give way to other traffic.

variant.question:
You are tracking 050 inbound XYZ VOR, which entry do you perform into the hold if the
inbound course is 270 with right turns?
While on IFR flight, a pilot has an emergency which causes a deviation from an ATC clearance. What action must be taken?

options.text: The appropriate ATC unit shall be notified of the action taken as soon as circumstances permit.
Submit a detailed report to ATC within 24 hours.
Request an amended clearance or cancel the IFR flight plan.

variant.question: You receive an IFR en-route clearance stating 'Clearance expires at 0920'What does it mean?

options.text: If not airborne until 920, a new clearance has to be issued.
The take-off clearance is expected at 920.
After 920 return to the ramp and file a new flight plan.

variant.question: An aircraft is on fire. The pilot declares a mayday and proceeds to a nearby runway. ATC informs the pilot that the runway is closed for administrative reasons. According to SERA (Standardised European Rules of the Air) the pilot:

options.text: Can still decide to land on the closed runway for safety reasons.
Must chose to land on the most suitable surface but not on the runway.
CANNOT land on a closed runway under any circumstances.
Must divert to a airport that is open to public air traffic.

variant.question:
The published holding procedure is:
all turns to the right
1-minute outbound
inbound Magnetic Track 030°
You are approaching the fix from 010° radial and the wind is calm. Select the appropriate entry procedure:
In a holding pattern, the standard turn is:

options.text: 25o  of bank or rate one turn, whichever requires the lessor bank
20o    of bank or rate one turn, whichever requires the lessor bank
20o    of bank or rate one turn, whichever requires the greater bank
25o    of bank or rate one turn, whichever requires the greater bank

variant.question: The outbound time in a holding pattern at 14000 ft or below in still air conditions is:

Refer to figure. 
 The inbound leg of the holding pattern is on the track (1) _____ and the outbound end is located at the (2) _____ end of the holding pattern.
You are instructed to enter a standard holding, inbound track 010 degrees.You are presently tracking 030 degrees. What is the appropriate holding entry?
Holding Procedures & Entry. The three entry sectors in a holding pattern have a zone of flexibility on either side of the sectors boundaries of;
When a pilot receives a clearance specifying the time of departure from the holding point, the pilot should..

options.text: adjust the holding pattern within its limits in order to leave the holding point at the time specified.
adjust the holding pattern within its limits in order to leave the holding point within +/- 1 minute from the time specified.
perform the holding pattern as it is designed, and using the aircraft performance, leave the holding point when specified.
perform the holding pattern until the holding fix, then adjust the speed in order to comply with the time specified.

variant.question: After intercepting the holding fix, you make a right hand turn to follow the holding pattern. What type of entry is being described?

options.text: Direct entry on a right-hand holding pattern
Offset entry on a right-hand holding pattern
Offset entry on a left-hand holding pattern
Direct entry on a left-hand holding pattern

variant.question: ATC instructs you to hold at "CLE" VOR, inbound track 270°, right turns. – You are presently tracking towards the "CLE" VOR on track 050°, therefore the appropriate type of entry into the hold is....
Holding procedures – offset entry – Above 14000 ft in still air, the outbound time on a 30-degree offset track is limited to..
Unless otherwise published or instructed by ATC, all turns after initial entry into the holding pattern shall be made into which direction?

options.text: First right and then to the left.
Teardrop to the left and then to the right.

variant.question: In a holding pattern, when the outbound leg is based on a DME distance, the outbound leg will end at:

options.text: Upon reaching the published DME distance.
1 NM before reaching the published DME distance.
0.5 NM before reaching the published DME distance.
30 seconds before reaching the published DME distance.

variant.question: In a holding pattern, the pilot should attempt to maintain the ___ by making allowance for wind by applying corrections to ___ during entry and while flying the holding pattern.
In a holding pattern all turns are to be made at a:

options.text: bank angle of 25° or a rate of 3° per second, whichever requires the lesser bank.
bank angle of 25° or a rate of 3° per second, whichever requires the higher bank.

variant.question: When you are asked to hold on a non-standard holding fix (eg en-route), in what direction are the turns expected to be made if no specific ATC instruction is received?

options.text: It depends upon the inbound holding track.

variant.question: An aircraft is making an entry into the CLE VOR standard holding pattern and the wind is calm. The inbound track is 270° and the aircraft is approaching from 050°. The entry will be...
Related to the three entry sectors in a holding pattern, there is a zone of flexibility on either side of the sector boundaries of:
In relation to the three entry sectors, the type of entry into the holding pattern shall be determined according to:
Regarding a hold, when does the outbound timing commence?

options.text: Overhead or abeam the hold point whichever is later
Overhead or abeam the hold point whichever is earlier

variant.question: Describe where the outbound timing begins in a holding pattern:

options.text: over or abeam the fix, whichever occurs later.
over or abeam the fix, whichever occurs earlier.

variant.question: When flying a holding pattern with the outbound leg length based on DME distance, the outbound leg terminates

options.text: as soon as the limiting DME distance is reached.
0.5 NM prior to reaching the limiting DME distance.
half a minute prior to reaching the limiting DME distance.
1 NM prior to reaching the limiting DME distance.

After flying over the hold fix for a second time, he/she performs a right turn and continues tracking around the hold procedure. 
 The entry procedure which is being described is:

The published holding procedure is:
• standard holding
• 1 minute outbound
• inbound Magnetic Track 010°

You maintain track for a specified time, and then perform a second left turn to intercept the 270 inbound radial of the same hold fix. An aircraft approaching the holding pattern makes a left turn on to heading 90 degrees for 1 min. Then it turns left for capturing the inbound magnetic track of 270 degrees. Select the appropriate entry procedure:

You have received holding instructions for a radio fix. The published holding procedure is: all turns to the right, 1 minute outbound, inbound MC 052° . You are approaching the fix on an inbound Magnetic Track 232° . Select the available entry procedure.

When performing a holding procedure, a pilot must comply with specified parameters such as speed rate of turn, timing and distance. If a pilot deviates from the holding procedure, he/she is at risk of:

options.text: Losing radio contact with Air Traffic Control.

variant.question: You are required to carry out an offset joining procedure to enter a holding pattern. What is the required track divergence from the reciprocal inbound track from on top the fix towards the outbound leg?
When a pilot is instructed by ATC to leave the hold at a specific time:

options.text: he must adjust the hold within its limits to leave at the specified time
he must adjust the hold within its limits then accelerate to meet the specified time
he must adjust the hold within its limits to leave +/- 1 minute of specified time
complete the hold and head to the fix then use aircraft thrust/power to leave at the specified time

variant.question: The following characteristics are specific for a holding pattern established at a VOR: standard turns, 1 minute outbound, inbound magnetic track of 010 degrees. If an aircraft is approaching the VOR on a heading of 030 degrees, the appropriate entry procedure would be..
A pilot is instructed to leave a holding pattern. When clearance is received specifying the time of departure from the holding point...

options.text: the pilot should adjust the pattern within the limits of the established holding procedure in order to leave the holding point at the time specified.
the pilot should adjust the pattern within the limits of the established holding procedure in order to leave the holding point at or up to 3 minutes after the time specified.
the pilot should adjust the pattern within the limits of the established holding procedure in order to leave the holding point at the time specified, +/- 1 minute.
the pilot should adjust the pattern within the limits of the established holding procedure in order to leave the holding point before or at the time specified.

variant.question: If a pilot is unable to comply with the procedures for normal conditions laid down for a holding pattern, they should;

options.text: advise ATC as early as possible.
execute a non-standard holding pattern in accordance with the performance of the aeroplane.
remain within the protected area, but may deviate from the prescribed holding pattern.
follow the radio communication failure procedure.

variant.question: When are you going to start your turn while flying on the outbound leg of a holding (leg specified by 1 NM DME per leg)?

• standard turns
• 1 minute outbound
• inbound Magnetic Track 000°
You are approaching the VOR from the South-West. Select the appropriate entry procedure:
In a standard holding pattern turns are made:

options.text: In a direction depending on the entry
In a direction depending on the wind direction

variant.question: Entering a holding pattern at FL 110 with a jet aircraft, which will be the maximum speed?
Standard airway holding pattern below 14 000 ft ?
Normally all turns, which are requested by a radar controller have to be executed as:

options.text: standard rate turns if not otherwise instructed by ATC.

variant.question: What is the meaning of “Expected Approach Time”? It is the time when an aircraft:

options.text: In the hold can expect to be Issued with the clearance to leave the holding.
Can expert to receive the en route clearance.
In the Initial Approach Fix can expect to receive the approach clearance.
Can expect to commence the descent.

variant.question: A pilot should report "Runway Vacated"...

options.text: As soon as the entire aircraft has passed over the holding point.
As soon as the aircraft is on the taxiway with taxi speed.
When the aircraft is turning to exit the runway.
As soon as the aircraft nose is beyond the limits of the runway.

variant.question: During cruise, after ATC handover, a pilot receives a route clearance up to a waypoint at an adjacent controlled airspace. While approaching the clearance limit waypoint, what must the pilot do?

options.text: Expect the appropriate ATC unit to Issue an amended clearance to the destination aerodrome, as soon as practicable.
Expect the appropriate ATC unit to Issue an amended clearance to the destination aerodrome, 5 minutes prior to reaching the clearance limit.
Perform a lateral offset from the filed flight-plan route, maintaining the frequency of the ATC unit which has provided him/her the last clearance.
Change frequency to the appropriate. ATC unit on his/her own initiative, and provide a full position report.

variant.question: You are on final when an aircraft enters the traffic circuit without proper authorisation and cuts you off. What should you do?

options.text: Let the aircraft land and inform ATC.
Speed up and pass the aircraft on the left.
Cut the aircraft off and continue to land since you have clearance to land.
Speed up and pass the aircraft on the right.

variant.question:
ATC transmit the following taxi clearance to an aircraft:
“FGACC, runway 27, wind 220 degrees 10 knots visibility 8 km, QNH 1019, transition level 45, time 06, squawk will be 3636. Taxi to holding point runway 27 via taxiway Bravo, cros runway 22, give way to Airbus crossing left to right”.
In accordance with ICAO Doc 4444, if the pilot is able to comply, what must his/her reply be?

options.text: “Taxi to holding point runway 27 via taxiway Bravo, cross runway 22, giving way to Airbus. Squawk 3636, QNH 1019, transition level 45, FGACC”.
“Taxi to holding point runway 27 via taxiway Bravo. Squawk 3636, QNH 1019, wind 220 degrees 10 knots, transition level 45, time 06, FGACC”.
“Taxi to holding point runway 27, cross runway 22, giving way to Airbus. Squawk 3636, QNH 1019, time 06, FGACC”.
“Taxi via taxiway Bravo, cross runway 22, giving way to Airbus. Aquawk 3636, QNH 1019, transition level 45, FGACC”.

variant.question: A pilot encountering windshear should report the fact to ATC

options.text: only if windshear has not been previously reported.
only if windshear has not been forecast.
if windshear has not been forecast or reported.
